thread.title: BREAKING: Rolf Harris CLEARED of sexual assault charges
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Rolf Harris CLEARED of sexual assault charges

title: BREAKING: Rolf Harris CLEARED of sexual assault charges
text:
PA CLEARED: Rolf Harris has been found not guilty of three charges of sexual assault 
A jury took just under a week to find the Australian not guilty of three of the seven alleged assaults following a second trial at London's Southwark Crown Court. 
Harris is currently in jail following a 2014 trial which saw him convicted of 12 sex offences against four female victims, one aged as young as seven or eight. 
But his defence team claimed the jury in the first trial had "got it wrong" and that the media frenzy had "without doubt made him vulnerable to people making accusations against him". 
GETTY ACCUSED: Rolf Harris was facing seven charges of sexual and indecent assault 
The pensioner declined to give evidence, instead silently watching proceedings first on video from Stafford prison and then later from the dock with a hearing loop. 
Harris showed no reaction as the not guilty verdicts were read out by the jury forewoman. 
Judge Alistair McCreath discharged the jury from deliberating on the further four counts he is accused of. 
MORE TO FOLLOW
